item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "You never have to change anything you got up in the middle of the night to write." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Kelly add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Kelly Moran
item.description: "I only know two things in life for certain: I know I love her and I know when her memory of our time together fades, I’ll still feel exactly the same as I do today. Time is irrelevant, as I once said to her. And I’m happy wasting every second of it on her." -- Kelly Moran

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Kelly Moran
item.description: "We are all the same and we are all different. What great friends we will be." -- Kelly Moran

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Terri St.Cloud
item.description: "I will not allow myself to be less than I am to meet anyone's expectations." -- Terri St.Cloud

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Walter Cronkite
item.description: "Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation." -- Walter Cronkite

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Men have called me mad; but the question is not yet settled, whether madness is or is not the loftiest intelligence– whether much that is glorious– whether all that is profound– does not spring from disease of thought– from moods of mind exalted at the expense of the general intellect." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Kelly add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Lock up your libraries if you like; but there is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Kelly Moran
item.description: "Before she knew it, she was just another set of eyes in a dusty attic, waiting for the stairs to creak." -- Kelly Moran

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Kelly Moran
item.description: "When the leaves stop falling wasn't her time to die, it was your time to live." -- Kelly Moran

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Kelly Moran
item.description: "The day I died was just like any other idle Thursday." -- Kelly Moran

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Kelly Moran
item.description: "I think only when you are truly alone can you see you never were." -- Kelly Moran

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Kelly Moran
item.description: "The truth is I do love you. Admitting that means opening myself up to all that pain when you leave. After you realize this wasn’t love, but gratitude." -- Kelly Moran

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Kelly Moran
item.description: "I can take two people, throw a world of obstacles at them, defy the odds, and still give them a happily-ever-after. Together. I am a romance author. What's your superpower?" -- Kelly Moran

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Kelly Moran
item.description: "The first sign that Karma was now in cahoots with the Devil Incarnate to ruin her existance should've been before sunrise and pre-coffee." -- Kelly Moran
